page.title: 07Language
page.content: Most of the inhabitants of this sparsely populated community speak English and Welsh. Most of the farms are occupied by people who are bilingual but whose mother tongue is Welsh. However in recent years some of the farms have been bought by entirely English speaking people, resulting in a very Welsh area becoming more Anglicized. In the owner-occupied cottages and pockets of houses in the area the same applies. All people speak English fluently,many speak Welsh fluently, some have a less fluent command of Welsh, some have a smattering, and a few have no knowledge of the language at all. There are two centres of worship in our block, one has services entirely in Welsh, and the other is bilingual. Public meeting and clubs are generally conducted in English.
